ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and the night when it is still,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And the night when dark and still,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and by the night when it covers the world with peace:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and by the calm of night,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And by oath of the night when it covers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: By the night when it darkens.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the night when it covers with darkness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And by the night when it is stillest,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and by the night when it darkens,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By the night when it darkeneth,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and by the night when it is calm!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And by the Night when it is still,-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And by the night when it is still (or darkens);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and by the night when it covers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And the night as it settles.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [by] the night when it covers with darkness,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [93:2] and [by] the night when it is still — or [sajā can mean] ‘when it envelops [all] in its darkness’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And by the night when it is stillest) and by the night when it becomes dark,
